intro: Paepalanthus leucophaeus, commonly known as the white-leaved puya, is a striking plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Xanthorrhoeaceae family, known for its unique and showy inflorescences. The plant features a rosette of broad, white or pale green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically clustered in a dense, spike-like structure and are often brightly colored. Paepalanthus leucophaeus is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
